p: The GSP model in the fifth column of Table 2 pools data from 21 New Hampshire surveys, 2010–2015. Interview-day temperature anomaly, season and year are included among the predictors. A statewide temperature index (mean 0.9°C, range –11.1 to +14.6°C) is defined as the mean of anomalies (departures from 1981–2010 daily normals) across the state’s four continuing US Historical Climatology Network stations (Durham, Keene, Hanover and First Connecticut Lake). Season is represented by three dummy variables with winter as the base category. Including year among the predictors tests for a time trend.
